required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: IMRT and Primary Transoral Surgery in the Treatment of Squamous Cell Carcinomas
clinical_study.official_title: Prospective Non-randomized Comparative Study Between IMRT and Primary Transoral Surgery in the Treatment of Squamous Cell Carcinomas of Early Local Stage of Oropharynx

lead_sponsor.agency: Gustave Roussy, Cancer Campus, Grand Paris

clinical_study.source: Gustave Roussy, Cancer Campus, Grand Paris

brief_summary.textblock: Compare patients' feelings in terms of swallowing ability assessed by the overall score of MD Anderson Dysphagia Inventory (MDADI) 2 years after starting treatment between patients who have been treated with IMRT and those who were treated by transoral surgery for a squamous cell carcinoma of the early stage oropharynx.

primary_outcome.measure: MD Anderson Dysphagia Inventory (MDADI) global score
primary_outcome.description: Score goes from 20 to 100. A higher score means a better ability to swallow

arm_group.description: IMRT on the primitive site and the lymph nodes. +/- Concomitant chemotherapy at the discretion of the meeting multidisciplinary
transoral resection of the primary tumor, with cervical lymph node dissection. Radiotherapy complementary according to the histological criteria of severity

intervention.description: The technique of transoral surgery will be left to the choice of the surgeon according to the equipment and the experience of the team and will be gathered. The options are: transoral surgery robot-assisted, endoscopic laser transoral surgery, transoral laser surgery classical instruments. The exact description of the resected area will be collected. of the cross-sections will be made for extemporaneous analysis if necessary in lateral margins and deep until complete excision.
Intensity modulation radiotherapy (RCMI or IMRT) will be performed using techniques static or rotational (arctherapy, tomotherapy). Restraint is recommended with thermoformed mask

study_pop.textblock: patients who have been treated with IMRT and those who were treated by transoral surgery for a carcinoma squamous cell of the early stage oropharynx

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
1. Age â‰¥ 18 years old
2. ECOG performance status 0-2
3. Histologically confirmed squamous cell carcinoma
4. Primitive localization of the oropharynx on the tonsil compartment or the tongue base
5. p16 or HPV status available
6. TNM classification AJCC7th T1 or T2
7. TNM classification AJCC7th N0 or N1
8. Patient and tumor that can be treated by radiotherapy or by transoral surgery
9. Patient who has not objected to participate after being informed about the study. The patient must be able and willing to cooperate in follow-up and study visits
Exclusion Criteria:
1. Severe medical comorbidity or other contraindication to radiotherapy or surgery
2. Primary tumor or unresectable lymphadenopathy
3. Metastatic disease
4. History of squamous cell carcinoma of the head and neck within 5 years
5. History of radiation therapy to the head and neck
6. Inability to undergo or complete radiation therapy follow-up consultations
7. History of cancer except free of any disease for at least 5 years, with the exception of non-melanoma skin cancers
8. Inability to complete questionnaires
9. Pregnant or lactating woman
10. Patient under tutorship or curatorship, deprived of liberty or unable to do so to express consent
